messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:  pro-life & official policies
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/30/01 11:58:14 PM Pacific Standard Time, SandraDodd@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/30/01 11:58:14 PM Pacific Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

<< There ARE official points of view. How many different pro-life
organizations
are there? Knights of Columbus (who go STRICTLY by Papal edict) and... any
other literature-producing organization? >>

My point was that there is no *one* official point of view covering all
prolifers. Equally, the NAACP and the Black Muslims may have official points
of view and/or policies on affirmative action, but that doesn't mean they
speak for all African-Americans. So Operation Rescue or Knights of Columbus
can have whatever official policy on ectopic pregnancies they want. That
doesn't make it "the official pro-life" policy. I'm sure amongst different
organizations you'll find lots of different policies, just as you will among
individuals.

candice
